Content:
CITES Certificate
For shipments from France to India involving endangered species (e.g., ivory, exotic leather), send a CITES Certificate via Express service to clear Indian customs.
Know Your Customer and POA
French exporters must ensure Indian importers provide Know Your Customer (KYC) documents (e.g., PAN card) and a Power of Attorney (POA) to UPS before clearance. This is mandatory for all non-document shipments to India, regardless of value.
MSDS-NON DG
Goods under IATA Special Provisions A67 (e.g., certain chemicals) need a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS). While not always required, shipments transiting via the UAE may be delayed without an MSDS or Non-Dangerous Goods (NON DG) declaration—include these and upload to IDIS.
Packing List
For multi-package shipments from France, attach a packing list to the invoice or combine them into one document with full details.
Info About Section Header: Paperwork needed for shipping from France to India.
Simplified Form: - **CITES Certificate**: For wildlife goods, send a CITES Certificate via Express from France.
- **KYC and POA**: Ensure your Indian buyer gives UPS their ID (KYC) and signed permission (POA)—mandatory for all non-documents.
- **MSDS/NON DG**: Include an MSDS for chemicals; add a NON DG letter if via UAE—upload to IDIS.
- **Packing List**: Multi-package shipments need a list with the invoice or combined.

Content:
SED (New Electronic Export System)
For exports from France to India, submit an electronic export declaration to French customs via UPS or your agent. Customs issues an Export Accompanying Document (EAD) with a Movement Reference Number (MRN), which must travel with the shipment. UPS handles EU exit clearance.
Informal Declarations
Shipments up to EUR 1,000 can use an informal declaration based on the invoice, unless restricted (e.g., embargoed goods). UPS clears these at the EU exit point.
UPS Service
UPS prepares formal declarations for free if over EUR 1,000—contact UPS France for assistance.
Info About Section Header: Documents required for exporting from France to India.
Simplified Form: - **SED**: File an electronic declaration in France; get an EAD with MRN to include with your shipment—UPS handles EU exit.
- **Informal**: Under EUR 1,000, use the invoice for clearance—UPS manages it unless restricted.
- **UPS Help**: Over EUR 1,000? UPS does formal declarations for free—call UPS France.

Content:
Post Office Boxes
UPS can’t deliver to P.O. Boxes in India—provide a full street address and phone number (mandatory for non-documents) for KYC.
Clearance Comments
From France, only documents go in a Docs Bag—non-documents (e.g., CDs, tokens) need a Non-DOC Bag, or Indian customs may fine you.
Master Air Waybill (MAWB)
Chemicals or valuables (e.g., diamond powder) from France need an MAWB for cargo clearance in India.
Airfreight Routing
Shipments land in Mumbai, then move to Calcutta (East), Bangalore (Karnataka), Delhi (North), Chennai/Hyderabad/Cochin (South), or stay in Mumbai—consignee can clear at transit.
Cargo Arrival Notice (CAN)
UPS India sends a CAN on arrival—consignee picks their broker or UPS’s.
Duty and Taxes
Non-refundable—if the Indian receiver refuses, costs bill back to France.
Customs Clearance Process
Consignees need an IEC and GST number for commercial goods. Non-documents must clear within 30 days, or they’re abandoned.
E-Way Bill
Goods over INR 50,000 (~EUR 550) moving across Indian states need an E-Way Bill—importers provide it, UPS France assists.
Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS)
Some French goods (e.g., electronics) need BIS certification—check https://bis.gov.in.
Custom Requirements
Upload a valid air waybill to IDIS with the invoice—missing docs delay clearance.
MRP Labeling
Retail goods from France must show MRP, product name, import date, importer details, and quantity.
Gifts & Samples
Label ‘Gift’ or ‘Sample’—samples under INR 10,000 (~EUR 110) may be duty-free; gifts face duties since Dec 2019.
Simplified Form: - **No P.O. Boxes**: Give a full address and phone for KYC.
- **Docs Only**: Use Docs Bag for papers—non-documents in NonkeepersDOC Bag or face fines.
- **MAWB**: Chemicals/valuable need an MAWB for cargo.
- **Routing**: Lands in Mumbai, then to regional airports—or clear at transit.
- **Duties**: Receiver skips payment? You pay in France—no refunds.
- **IEC/GST**: Needed for commercial; clear in 30 days.
- **E-Way Bill**: Over EUR 550 across states? Importer needs it—UPS France helps.
- **BIS**: Check if your goods need certification.
- **Air Waybill**: Upload to IDIS with invoice—or expect delays.
- **MRP**: Retail items need price, name, date, and importer info.
- **Gifts/Samples**: Mark them—samples under EUR 110 may skip duty, gifts don’t.

Content: Service from France to India covers select cities—check INTLDI Time in Transit with Indian postal codes. No service to Andaman and Nicobar Islands or Lakshadweep. Provide a full address and phone (mandatory for non-documents). Rest days: Sundays and Indian holidays. Time zone: GMT +5:50. Language: English. Currency: INR.
Simplified Form: - **Coverage**: Ships to select cities—verify with INTLDI.

Content:
Duties and Taxes
Bill to France, India, or a third party (needs name, country, account). Outside India adds a Duty and Tax Forwarding surcharge.
Shipping Charges
Bill to France, India (with account), or a third party (details needed). No COD—use Free Domicile (F/D) terms.
Payment Methods
Card, check, or cash bills only France.
Split Duty and VAT (SDV)
Freight/duties to France or third party, taxes to India or third party—surcharge applies.
Third-Party Billing
India-only shipments can’t bill to France unless EU-based with VAT ID.
Simplified Form: - **Duties/Taxes**: Bill to France, India, or third party—outside India adds a fee.
- **Shipping**: Bill to France, India (needs account), or third party—no COD, use F/D.
- **Split Billing**: Freight to France, taxes to India—extra charge.
- **Third-Party**: India-only can’t bill France unless EU with VAT.

Content:
Medical Items
French medical goods need a Health Department NOC on arrival—personal use too. UPS India helps with docs; expect 2-3 day delays. Lab equipment needs a catalog.
Radios
Require an Indian Wireless Planning Wing license.
Televisions
Color TVs need a DGFT license, Cargo mode only.
Jewelry
Gold/silver up to USD 2,500 ships via Cargo with MAWB—Courier banned. Non-precious jewelry (e.g., brass) is fine.
Leather Goods
Need a Wildlife NOC and origin certificate.
Vitamins
Require an Assistant Drug Controller NOC—use scientific names on invoices.
Toys
Need safety certificates (e.g., ASTM F963)—tested by NABL labs.
Telecom Equipment
Phones need IMEI on device and invoice, DOT-registered.
Satellite Equipment
Needs a Wireless Planning Wing license and NOC.
Chemicals
Include MSDS and analysis—customs may test.
Clothing
Needs a dye test certificate from France—EU exempt from Azo dye tests.
Nutritional Supplements
Require a Drug Controller NOC.
Drugs/Medicine
Need an Assistant Drug Controller NOC—use scientific names.
Phones
IMEI mandatory on device and invoice.
Brochures
With samples? They’re dutiable.
Catalogs
Always dutiable—not samples.
RSA Tokens
Dutiable—show real value.
SIM Cards
Resale needs a DOT NOC.
Tapes
Films need a synopsis—expect duties.
Food
Needs an FSSAI NOC—personal use requires passport.
Personal Imports
C2C: 77% duty; B2C: 43% with proof.
Textiles
Need a dye certificate from France or India.
Pakistan Goods
200% duty if routed via France.
Info About Section Header: Special rules for goods from France to India.
Simplified Form: - **Medical**: NOC needed—UPS aids, delays 2-3 days. Lab gear needs catalog.
- **Jewelry**: Up to USD 2,500 via Cargo—non-precious OK.

Content: No gift exemption from France to India—duties apply at 0 INR. Banned gifts: perishables, plants, precious stones, gold, silver, supplements, drugs, cosmetics, confectionery, fruits, veggies, spices, honey, chocolate, tinned food, meat, milk, commercial meds. Personal use needs customs approval. Duty: 77% on assessable value (invoice + freight + insurance).
Simplified Form: - **Banned**: No perishables, plants, gold, supplements, drugs, candy, fruits, spices, honey, chocolate, tinned food, meat, milk, meds.

Content:
Paperless Invoice - Imports
India accepts UPS Paperless Invoice for small packages from France.
Invoice Details
Include: French exporter’s name/address/contact, Indian importer’s name (matching KYC), phone, email, address, invoice number/date, goods description, HS Code, origin (France), quantity, price, total, Incoterms (e.g., CIF), purpose, and costs.
Paperless Invoice - Exports
Available for small package exports from France.
Simplified Form: - **Paperless Imports**: India OKs it for small packages.
- **Details**: List French sender, Indian receiver (per KYC), phone, email, address, invoice info, HS Code, France origin, prices, Incoterms, purpose, costs.

Content: From France, up to 2 kg: bonds, cash letters, manuscripts, tickets, blank forms, blueprints, charts, intercompany mail, proposals, seismic data, spec sheets, visa apps (to embassies), graphs, Mylars, print-outs, price lists, used traveler’s checks, reports, bids. Blank checks restricted. UPS France offers forms online/print.
Simplified Form: - **Documents**: Up to 2 kg—bonds, letters, manuscripts, tickets, forms, blueprints, charts, mail, proposals, seismic, specs, visas (embassies), graphs, Mylars, print-outs, prices, used checks, reports, bids.
- **Forms**: Get from UPS France online or print.

Content:
Samples
Max 5 pieces from France—Mumbai bans duty-free clearance; Bangalore/Delhi may allow it.
Prohibited Gifts
No perishables, plants, stones, gold, silver, supplements, drugs, cosmetics, confectionery, fruits, veggies, spices, honey, chocolate, tinned food, meat, milk, meds—personal use needs approval.
Computers
Laptops/PCs (HSN 8741) need a Restricted Import License.
Seeds
Need a Plant Quarantine NOC—Cargo only.
Precious Items
Stones, gold, silver via Cargo only.
Animals/Plants
Banned.
Personal Effects
Cargo only with passport, visa, ticket, 6-month travel history.
Used Items
Banned without SIL.
Perishables
Cargo only with NOCs (e.g., FSSAI).
Guns
Banned—exceptions for licensed shooters or film with MHA NOC.
E-Cigarettes
Fully banned.
Maps
Incorrect India borders banned.
Used Electronics
Need MOEF NOC.
Drones
Banned unless with DGCA clearance, airworthiness cert, SIL.
Antiques/Artwork
Restricted from France—needs ISC contract; art must be recent, appraised.
Lithium Batteries
UN3480 banned by airlines; metal batteries restricted.
Plastics
Single-use banned since July 2022 (e.g., straws).
Info About Section Header: Banned or restricted items from France to India.
Simplified Form: - **Samples**: Max 5—Mumbai dutiable, others may not be.
- **Banned Gifts**: No perishables, plants, gold, supplements, drugs, candy, fruits, spices, honey, chocolate, tinned, meat, milk, meds.

Content: Check Calculate Time and Cost for France-to-India service details. Options: UPS Worldwide Express Saver, Expedited, Express Freight, Freight Midday, Economy DDU, Economy DDP, Express Plus, Express. Not all reach every Indian address.
Info About Section Header: Shipping services from France to India.
Simplified Form: - **Check Tool**: Use Calculate Time and Cost.
- **Options**: Express Saver, Expedited, Freight, Freight Midday, Economy DDU/DDP, Express Plus, Express.

Content:
Ata Carnet
Temporary exhibition goods from France—re-export in 6 months.
Triptyque
Vehicles duty-free for 6 months (extendable) with auto club membership.
Raw Materials
Duty-free from France for processing—claim drawback on re-export.
Wood Packing
Use ISPM 15-treated wood over 6mm.
Repair and Return
Invoices need details, origin (France), value, ‘Repair and Return’—duty on repair costs.
Personal Shipments
C2C: 35% duty (10% with proof); B2C: 10% with proof, 35% without (77.28% for gifts).
Gifts
All dutiable.
Samples
Under INR 10,000 (~EUR 110), mark ‘SAMPLES – FREE OF COST’ for duty-free.
Simplified Form: - **Personal**: C2C 35% (10% with proof); B2C 10% with proof, 35% without (77% for gifts).
- **Samples**: Under EUR 110, label ‘FREE’ for no duty.

Content: No de minimis value from France to India—duties apply at 0 INR.
Max weight: 70 kg (150 lbs). Max length: 274 cm (107.9 in). Max dimensions: 400 cm (157.5 in) combined (length + girth).
